info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 9:37PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Suffolk County through 1030 PM EDT... At 936 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mattituck, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Mattituck around 940 PM EDT. Peconic around 950 PM EDT. Southold around 955 PM EDT. Greenport around 1005 PM EDT. Noyack and Shelter Island around 1010 PM EDT. Sag Harbor and Bridgehampton around 1015 PM EDT. Gardiners Island and East Hampton around 1030 PM EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
